text: On the latest episode of the #science #podcast This Week in Virology #TWiV Daniel Griffin provides a clinical update on #COVID19 then we review #sars_cov2 infections in non-humans, vesicular stomatitis in Kansas horses, and answer listener questions https://t.co/fKZyxIyL4F https://t.co/sLifY6pv1k

On the latest #TWiV Daniel Griffin's clinical update on #COVID19, dexamethasone trial, two Ebolavirus outbreaks in DRC, clinical and virological aspects of asymptomatic #SARSCoV2 infections, age-dependent effects on transmission, and listener email. https://t.co/hzYOX1sihR https://t.co/A6DGo6xAay

On the latest #TWiV we discuss #SARSCoV2 D614G amino acid change in spike glyprotein, duration of infectious virus shedding from patients, virus transmission among hamsters infected in the laboratory, and tackle listener email https://t.co/TfUMvXJOSo #COVID19 https://t.co/0RUqGEqiom

Daniel Griffin provides a clinical update on COVID-19, then Ralph Baric joins #TWiV to discuss #SARSCoV2 transmission, vaccines, diagnostic tests, and a new animal model from his laboratory that does not use transgenic mice https://t.co/mEgrp7Jegc https://t.co/3fMReKo8UQ

Paul Stays Home, the free illustrated childrens book about #COVID19 and #SARSCoV2 is now available in English, Spanish, Greek, Italian, French, and Persian https://t.co/LK8Ssct3k7 @profsuslopez @Viro_ConacytMX https://t.co/ds2xUN2D63

On the latest episode of the #science #podcast This Week in Virology #TWiV Daniel Griffin provides a clinical update on #COVID19 then Sabra Klein joins us to discuss the effect of sex, gender, and age on viral infectious disease, including #COVID19  https://t.co/IBReVA9fK2 https://t.co/Qxh7oFeLES

Want to know the real reason NIH withdrew @EcoHealthNYC grant to study #coronavirus in bats in China? Listen to @PeterDaszak on the latest #TWiV This Week in Virology #science #podcast #grumpyvirologists  providing information needed to prevent future pandemics https://t.co/uMDchz5z6N
